intro: Metrosideros decurrens, commonly known as the coastal rata, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in salty, windy environments. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces showy red or orange flowers in clusters. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, and it plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils.
